intro: Gnetum moluccense, commonly known as the Moluccan gnetum, is a member of the Gnetophyta class, a group of gymnosperms that includes only three genera. It is a flowering plant with unique characteristics, such as the presence of vessel elements in its xylem, which is typically found in angiosperms. The plant is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive shape, while its flowers are unisexual and arranged in clusters. Gnetum moluccense plays a role in its ecosystem as a food source for various insects and animals.
